"SECTION 1. FINDINGS." "Congress finds the evolving roles and resource needs of the Department of Defense and Homeland Security for homeland defense. The decision for base closures in 2005 was made before September 11, 2001. The costs and personnel requirements of ongoing military operations are unknown. Additional funds are needed for current missions and military transformation. Congress lacks the opportunity to thoroughly review policy decisions before the Global Posture Review." The estimated costs of implementing base closures and realignments in the 2005 round are $15 billion, with net savings expected by 2011. SEC. 2. Two-year postponement of 2005 base closure and realignment round. The Defense Base Closure and Realignment Act of 1990 is amended to postpone the closure or realignment of military installations from 2005 to 2007. Commission review and recommendations deadlines are also extended to 2007. The Defense Base Closure and Realignment Act of 1990 is amended to delay military installation closures from 2005 to 2007. Deadlines for commission review and recommendations are also extended to 2007. The Defense Base Closure and Realignment Act of 1990 is amended to delay military installation closures from 2005 to 2007, with various sections of the Act being updated to reflect the new timeline. The Defense Base Closure and Realignment Act of 1990 is amended to delay military installation closures from 2005 to 2007, with updates to various sections of the Act to reflect the new timeline, including changes to subsections (d)(4) and (d)(5) as well as section 2913.
